definition: (coll.) an American/person from the United States

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]

sentences.english: Some Americans have said that politics is the art of the possible.
sentences.chinese: 有些老美說，政治是一切可能的藝術。

sentences.english: Americans can be very picky when it comes to colors.
sentences.chinese: 老美對顏色的挑剔通常到了吹毛求疵的程度。

sentences.english: Many Americans can hardly make out Chinese people because of the different cultural background.
sentences.chinese: 由於文化背景不同，許多老美不瞭解老中。

sentences.english: Only three shows left. Can you stand it, America?
sentences.chinese: 現在僅剩下3場秀了，老美們，你們還好吧？

sentences.english: Why is Fanta so much more popular abroad than in the United States?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼老外比老美更喜歡芬達呢？

definition: (in early CCP propaganda) United States (as an imperialist nation)/(in more recent times) a neutral, colloquial term for the United States
United States/name of a country that formerly existed near Samarkand
Sichuanese pidgin (the mix of Standard Mandarin and Sichuanese dialect)/(Tw) surname Trump
